text:
Q: Could the extent of lymphadenectomy be modified by neoadjuvant chemotherapy in cervical cancer?
A: No. Rationale: The frequency and topographic distribution of LNM are not modified by NACT, and clinical non-responders showed more involved LNs.
label: No
question: Could the extent of lymphadenectomy be modified by neoadjuvant chemotherapy in cervical cancer?
rationale_src: The frequency and topographic distribution of LNM are not modified by NACT, and clinical non-responders showed more involved LNs. A systemic and extensive lymphadenectomy should be performed in patients treated with NACT plus surgery regardless of the response to NACT.

text:
Q: Is translocation t ( 11 ; 18 ) ( q21 ; q21 ) predictive of response to chemotherapy with 2CdA in patients with gastric MALT lymphoma?
A: No. Rationale: Our findings suggest that the presence of the API2-MALT1 fusion transcript resulting from t(11;18)(q21;q21) does not adversely affect the response of gastric.
label: No
question: Is translocation t ( 11 ; 18 ) ( q21 ; q21 ) predictive of response to chemotherapy with 2CdA in patients with gastric MALT lymphoma?
rationale_src: Our findings suggest that the presence of the API2-MALT1 fusion transcript resulting from t(11;18)(q21;q21) does not adversely affect the response of gastric MALT lymphoma to chemotherapy with 2CdA. 2CdA appears to be an attractive agent for treatment of gastric MALT lymphoma unresponsive to H. pylori eradication, including those positive for t(11;18)(q21;q21).

text:
Q: Do mild and moderate hypothermia ( alpha-stat ) impair the coupling between local cerebral blood flow and metabolism in rats?
A: No. Rationale: Anesthesia and hypothermia induce divergent changes in mean CBF and CGU.
label: No
question: Do mild and moderate hypothermia ( alpha-stat ) impair the coupling between local cerebral blood flow and metabolism in rats?
rationale_src: Anesthesia and hypothermia induce divergent changes in mean CBF and CGU. However, local analysis demonstrates a well-maintained linear relationship between LCBF and LCGU during normothermic and hypothermic anesthesia.

text:
Q: Does surgical approach influence the outcome of incidental gallbladder carcinoma?
A: No. Rationale: These results would seem to lend support to the opinion that LC does not worsen the prognosis for incidental GC, regardless of.
label: No
question: Does surgical approach influence the outcome of incidental gallbladder carcinoma?
rationale_src: These results would seem to lend support to the opinion that LC does not worsen the prognosis for incidental GC, regardless of whether the tumor was detected during or after cholecystectomy.

text:
Q: Is familial early-onset diabetes a typical MODY in several Tunisian patients?
A: No. Rationale: A molecular defect in known MODY genes has been excluded in 11 patients with early-onset diabetes suggesting that other genetic causes may.
label: No
question: Is familial early-onset diabetes a typical MODY in several Tunisian patients?
rationale_src: A molecular defect in known MODY genes has been excluded in 11 patients with early-onset diabetes suggesting that other genetic causes may explain diabetes in these families. In such cases, new generation sequencing approaches may be well appropriate to identify specific molecular etiologies from extended families and to establish a strategy of molecular diagnostic of MODY in Tunisia.

text:
Q: Does tyrosinemia I , a model for human diseases mediated by 2-oxoacid-utilizing dioxygenases : hepatotoxin suppression by NTBC normalize hepatic collagen metabolism?
A: No. Rationale: Normalization of hepatic collagen formation, highly desirable in all fibrotic liver diseases, is not achieved by NTBC in tyrosinemia I.
label: No
question: Does tyrosinemia I , a model for human diseases mediated by 2-oxoacid-utilizing dioxygenases : hepatotoxin suppression by NTBC normalize hepatic collagen metabolism?
rationale_src: Normalization of hepatic collagen formation, highly desirable in all fibrotic liver diseases, is not achieved by NTBC in tyrosinemia I. By establishing the molecular cause for this failure, our results also establish a rational approach to identify inhibitors that achieve that goal, either by joint 4-HPPD / P-4H inhibition, or by inhibition of only P-4H.

text:
Q: Do clinical and hematologic features reliably identify children with unsuspected meningococcal disease?
A: No. Rationale: Children ultimately diagnosed with meningococcal disease have commonly been evaluated as outpatients and discharged to home before diagnosis.
label: No
question: Do clinical and hematologic features reliably identify children with unsuspected meningococcal disease?
rationale_src: Children ultimately diagnosed with meningococcal disease have commonly been evaluated as outpatients and discharged to home before diagnosis. Of the hematologic parameters frequently used in the evaluation of fever, only the band count differs significantly between young febrile children with UMD and those with negative cultures. Because UMD is uncommon in young febrile pediatric outpatients, however, the predictive value of the band count is low. Thus, the complete blood count is not routinely helpful for the diagnosis of UMD.

text:
Q: Does increased lung water without hypocapnia cause central sleep apnoea in a lamb model?
A: No. Rationale: These results support the view that hypocapnia is essential for CSA, and demonstrated that increased EVLW causes tachypnoea but not CSA.
label: No
question: Does increased lung water without hypocapnia cause central sleep apnoea in a lamb model?
rationale_src: These results support the view that hypocapnia is essential for CSA, and demonstrated that increased EVLW causes tachypnoea but not CSA.

text:
Q: Is metformin-induced thyrotropin suppression associated with cardiac effects?
A: No. Rationale: Our results show that the TSH-suppressive effect observed in patients taking metformin is not associated with peripheral markers of thyroid hormone excess.
label: No
question: Is metformin-induced thyrotropin suppression associated with cardiac effects?
rationale_src: Our results show that the TSH-suppressive effect observed in patients taking metformin is not associated with peripheral markers of thyroid hormone excess, at least at the cardiac level.

text:
Q: Do reductions in blood pressure following energy restriction for weight loss rebound after re-establishment of energy balance in overweight and obese subjects?
A: No. Rationale: The hypotensive effects of caloric restriction do not rebound upon return to eucaloric intake at a reduced body weight, and a high.
label: No
question: Do reductions in blood pressure following energy restriction for weight loss rebound after re-establishment of energy balance in overweight and obese subjects?
rationale_src: The hypotensive effects of caloric restriction do not rebound upon return to eucaloric intake at a reduced body weight, and a high sodium intake does not appear to alter the hypotensive effects of weight loss. This reinforces the clinical importance of weight loss and supports the recommendation that strategies for promoting long-term weight loss should become the primary focus of dietary efforts to control BP in overweight patients.

text:
Q: Is ecological niche differentiation of polyploidization supported by environmental differences among species in a cosmopolitan grass genus?
A: No. Rationale: Our results suggest that these commonly held hypotheses about the effects of polyploidization on ecological distributions are not universally applicable.
label: No
question: Is ecological niche differentiation of polyploidization supported by environmental differences among species in a cosmopolitan grass genus?
rationale_src: Our results suggest that these commonly held hypotheses about the effects of polyploidization on ecological distributions are not universally applicable. Correlative biogeographic studies like ours provide a necessary first step for suggesting specific hypotheses that require experimental verification. A combination of genetic, physiological, and ecological studies will be required to achieve a better understanding of the role of polyploidization in niche evolution.

text:
Q: Can bisphosphonate treatment be stopped in a growing child with skeletal fragility?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: The patient has been restarted on IV APD therapy.
label: Uncertain
question: Can bisphosphonate treatment be stopped in a growing child with skeletal fragility?
rationale_src: The patient has been restarted on IV APD therapy. This case has led us to consider whether bisphosphonate therapy can be discontinued in a child with fragility fractures before his/her linear growth has ceased?

text:
Q: Midwives' competence: is it affected by working in a rural location?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: It is often assumed that midwives in rural areas where there are fewer deliveries, will be less competent and confident in their.
label: Uncertain
question: Midwives' competence: is it affected by working in a rural location?
rationale_src: It is often assumed that midwives in rural areas where there are fewer deliveries, will be less competent and confident in their practice. Our exploratory study suggests that the issue of competence is far more complex and deserves further attention.

text:
Q: Should HIV-infected patients be screened for silent myocardial ischaemia using gated myocardial perfusion SPECT?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: In male HIV-infected patients older than 52 years and with at least two other CRFs, screening for SMI using myocardial SPECT was.
label: Uncertain
question: Should HIV-infected patients be screened for silent myocardial ischaemia using gated myocardial perfusion SPECT?
rationale_src: In male HIV-infected patients older than 52 years and with at least two other CRFs, screening for SMI using myocardial SPECT was about four times more likely to be positive than in the general population. This may motivate physicians to advise these patients to undergo more systematic screening for SMI using this technique.

text:
Q: Do parents recall and understand children's weight status information after BMI screening?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: While parents remember that their child's body mass index is higher than recommended, they are unable to remember much of the information.
label: Uncertain
question: Do parents recall and understand children's weight status information after BMI screening?
rationale_src: While parents remember that their child's body mass index is higher than recommended, they are unable to remember much of the information and advice provided about the result.

text:
Q: CPAP therapy in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and obstructive sleep apnea: does it offer a better quality of life and sleep?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Effective CPAP treatment in IPF patients with OSA results in a significant improvement in daily living activities based on the FOSQ, namely.
label: Uncertain
question: CPAP therapy in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and obstructive sleep apnea: does it offer a better quality of life and sleep?
rationale_src: Effective CPAP treatment in IPF patients with OSA results in a significant improvement in daily living activities based on the FOSQ, namely an OSA-specific follow-up instrument. Improvement was also noted in other questionnaires assessing quality of life, though not to a statistically significant degree, probably because of the multifactorial influences of IPF on physical and mental health. The probability of poor CPAP compliance was high and could only be eliminated with intense follow-up by the CPAP clinic staff.

text:
Q: Is a specialised training of phonological awareness indicated in every preschool child?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: A specialized training program to improve phonologic awareness as a basis for reading and writing in every kindergarten and preschool child seems.
label: Uncertain
question: Is a specialised training of phonological awareness indicated in every preschool child?
rationale_src: A specialized training program to improve phonologic awareness as a basis for reading and writing in every kindergarten and preschool child seems to be unnecessary. However, children with temporary hearing deficits benefit from such a program. For all other children general perception training may be sufficient.

text:
Q: Is it Crohn's disease?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Granulomatous myelotoxicity and enteritis developed in a 21 year old female within 3 weeks of initiating sulfasalazine for rheumatoid arthritis.
label: Uncertain
question: Is it Crohn's disease?
rationale_src: Granulomatous myelotoxicity and enteritis developed in a 21 year old female within 3 weeks of initiating sulfasalazine for rheumatoid arthritis. Following a short course of corticosteroids, the patient had resolution of her cholestatic hepatitis, rash, eosinophilia, and gastrointestinal symptoms with no residual manifestations at 7 months follow-up. Although severe reactions to sulfasalazine are rare and unpredictable, practicing physicians should be aware of unusual clinical presentations of toxicity when prescribing sulfasalazine.

label: Uncertain
question: Are lifetime prevalence of impetigo, molluscum and herpes infection really increased in children having atopic dermatitis?
rationale_src: The lifetime prevalence of IC was indeed higher in young children with a history of AD.

A: Uncertain. Rationale: Despite government assistance, low-income individuals use vision care services less often than wealthy individuals.
label: Uncertain
question: Does government assistance improve utilization of eye care services by low-income individuals?
rationale_src: Despite government assistance, low-income individuals use vision care services less often than wealthy individuals.

Q: Prostatic syndrome and pleural effusion: are they different diseases?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Although the association of prostate and lung cancer is uncommon, the possibility of synchronous tumors should be considered in patients with urinary.
label: Uncertain
question: Prostatic syndrome and pleural effusion: are they different diseases?
rationale_src: Although the association of prostate and lung cancer is uncommon, the possibility of synchronous tumors should be considered in patients with urinary and pulmonary symptoms suggestive of neoplasm. It is important to determine if the lesion is a metastasis, since the prognosis depends on the second tumor.

Q: Do older patients receive adequate stroke care?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Older patients were less likely to receive diagnostic investigations and lifestyle modification advice than younger patients.
label: Uncertain
question: Do older patients receive adequate stroke care?
rationale_src: Older patients were less likely to receive diagnostic investigations and lifestyle modification advice than younger patients. Guidelines need to be adopted to ensure prompt evidence-based stroke care in the outpatient setting.

Q: Is aPOE ε2 allele associated with larger regional cortical thicknesses and volumes?
A: Yes. Rationale: The APOE ε2 allele is associated with larger regional cortical thicknesses and volumes in mild cognitive impairment and AD.
label: Yes
question: Is aPOE ε2 allele associated with larger regional cortical thicknesses and volumes?
rationale_src: The APOE ε2 allele is associated with larger regional cortical thicknesses and volumes in mild cognitive impairment and AD.

text:
Q: Does the PARsylation activity of tankyrase in adipose tissue modulate systemic glucose metabolism in mice?
A: Yes. Rationale: Systemic glucose homeostasis is regulated by the PARsylation activity of TNKS in adipocytes.
label: Yes
question: Does the PARsylation activity of tankyrase in adipose tissue modulate systemic glucose metabolism in mice?
rationale_src: Systemic glucose homeostasis is regulated by the PARsylation activity of TNKS in adipocytes. This regulation is mediated in part by adipocyte-secreted factors that modulate hepatic glucose production. Pharmacological TNKS inhibition could potentially be used to improve glucose tolerance.

text:
Q: Does specific binding of hypochlorite-oxidized HDL to platelet CD36 trigger proinflammatory and procoagulant effects?
A: Yes. Rationale: From these results we conclude that specific binding of hyp-OxHDL to platelet CD36 is essential for the proinflammatory and procoagulant effects of.
label: Yes
question: Does specific binding of hypochlorite-oxidized HDL to platelet CD36 trigger proinflammatory and procoagulant effects?
rationale_src: From these results we conclude that specific binding of hyp-OxHDL to platelet CD36 is essential for the proinflammatory and procoagulant effects of hyp-OxHDL shown within this work. The contribution of other receptors besides CD36 to specific binding of hyp-OxHDL to the platelet membrane appears to be minimal, at best.

Q: Does azimilide reduce emergency department visits and hospitalizations in patients with an implantable cardioverter-defibrillator in a placebo-controlled clinical trial?
A: Yes. Rationale: Azimilide significantly reduces the number of ED visits and hospitalizations in patients with an ICD at high risk of arrhythmias.
label: Yes
question: Does azimilide reduce emergency department visits and hospitalizations in patients with an implantable cardioverter-defibrillator in a placebo-controlled clinical trial?
rationale_src: Azimilide significantly reduces the number of ED visits and hospitalizations in patients with an ICD at high risk of arrhythmias.

text:
Q: Does interferon induce insulin resistance in patients with chronic active hepatitis C?
A: Yes. Rationale: These results indicate that interferon therapy for 2 weeks induces insulin resistance in the splanchnic, as well as peripheral tissues, in patients.
label: Yes
question: Does interferon induce insulin resistance in patients with chronic active hepatitis C?
rationale_src: These results indicate that interferon therapy for 2 weeks induces insulin resistance in the splanchnic, as well as peripheral tissues, in patients with chronic active hepatitis C. Therefore, more careful observation may be needed during interferon therapy in subjects with impaired glucose tolerance.

Q: Does yeast strain affect phenolic concentration in Pinot noir wines made by microwave maceration with early pressing?
A: Yes. Rationale: The novel winemaking process produced Pinot noir wine that was stable 37 days after fruit had been harvested and yeast strain choice.
label: Yes
question: Does yeast strain affect phenolic concentration in Pinot noir wines made by microwave maceration with early pressing?
rationale_src: The novel winemaking process produced Pinot noir wine that was stable 37 days after fruit had been harvested and yeast strain choice significantly impacted the stability and phenolic character of wine.

Q: Does influence of the organization of binary mix on their compactibility?
A: Yes. Rationale: This study clearly demonstrates the influence of the organization of binary mixes on their compactibility.
label: Yes
question: Does influence of the organization of binary mix on their compactibility?
rationale_src: This study clearly demonstrates the influence of the organization of binary mixes on their compactibility. The adhering material makes a percolating network governing the tensile strength of the tablet. From an industrial point of view, it is possible to improve the compactibility of binary mixes without changing their composition by selecting the appropriate organization.

Q: Do increased speed and image quality in single-shot fast spin echo imaging via variable refocusing flip angles?
A: Yes. Rationale: vrfSSFSE increases speed at 3T over conventional SSFSE via reduced SAR, and when combined with full-Fourier acquisition can improve image quality, although.
label: Yes
question: Do increased speed and image quality in single-shot fast spin echo imaging via variable refocusing flip angles?
rationale_src: vrfSSFSE increases speed at 3T over conventional SSFSE via reduced SAR, and when combined with full-Fourier acquisition can improve image quality, although with some increased sensitivity to cardiac motion-related signal loss.

Q: Do aging mesenchymal stem cells fail to protect because of impaired migration and antiinflammatory response?
A: Yes. Rationale: Taken together, the decreased expression of cytokine and chemokine receptors in aged B-MSCs compromises their protective role by perturbing the potential of.
label: Yes
question: Do aging mesenchymal stem cells fail to protect because of impaired migration and antiinflammatory response?
rationale_src: Taken together, the decreased expression of cytokine and chemokine receptors in aged B-MSCs compromises their protective role by perturbing the potential of B-MSCs to become activated and mobilize to the site of injury.

text:
Q: Are enhancement of muscle mitochondrial oxidative capacity and alterations in insulin action lipid species dependent : potent tissue-specific effects of medium-chain fatty acids?
A: Yes. Rationale: MCFAs reduce adiposity and preserve insulin action in muscle and adipose, despite inducing steatosis and insulin resistance in the liver.
label: Yes
question: Are enhancement of muscle mitochondrial oxidative capacity and alterations in insulin action lipid species dependent : potent tissue-specific effects of medium-chain fatty acids?
rationale_src: MCFAs reduce adiposity and preserve insulin action in muscle and adipose, despite inducing steatosis and insulin resistance in the liver. Dietary supplementation with MCFAs may therefore be beneficial for preventing obesity and peripheral insulin resistance.
